MODding the AI 

The Sample MOD include a new NOD personality called Sample MODded AI.  This personality changes takes the existing NOD Balanced personality and updates its build order and adds a new targeting heuristic.  The first thing done was to copy the current NODOptimal.xml file from the CnC3XML\SkirmishAI\Personalities folder, this is the balanced personality file.  I renamed this file in the SampleMOD to SampleNodPersonality.xml and included it in the MODs main mod.xml file.  Then inside this file replace the id, PersonalityType, and then the PersonalityUIName fields as so:

<AIPersonalityDefinition

       id="1NODMac"

       PersonalityType="1NODMac"

       PersonalityUIName="Personality:Mac"

       SkirmishPersonality="true"

       SecondsTillTargetsCanExpire="15.0"

       ChanceForTargetToExpire="100"

       MaxBuildingsToBeDefensiveTarget_Small="0"

       MaxBuildingsToBeDefensiveTarget_Med="0"

       ChanceForUnitsToUpgrade="100"

       ChanceToUseAllUnitsForDefenseTarget_Small="0"

       ChanceToUseAllUnitsForDefenseTarget_Med="0"

       ChanceToUseAllUnitsForDefenseTarget_Large="0"

       DesiredExcessPowerBuffer="20"

       BaseCompactness="0.75"

       DefaultThreatFindRadius="0"

       UnitBuilderCostEffectivenessWeight="1.0"

       UnitBuilderMoneyVersusTimePreference="0.5"

       UnitBuilderOverallOffensivePreference="100%"

       UnitBuilderOverallDefensivePreference="100%"

       Expansion_TiberiumSearchRadius="1000"

       Expansion_MaxTiberiumRemaining="22000"

       ReactiveDefenseRadius="1000"

       RepairBuildingsAtDifficulty="MEDIUM HARD BRUTAL"

       EmergencyManagerHandleNoPowerAtDifficulty="MEDIUM HARD BRUTAL"

       EmergencyManagerHandleNoIncomeAtDifficulty="EASY MEDIUM HARD BRUTAL"

       EmergencyManagerHandleNoConyardAtDifficulty="EASY MEDIUM HARD BRUTAL"

       StructureSaveChanceEasy="0.0"

       StructureSaveChanceMedium="0.01"

       StructureSaveChanceHard="1.0"

       >

Note this is just the first step, we’ll now go into adding a new target heuristic and opening move which will be defined in the file above, but first lets look at setting up a new opening move.
Setting Up an Opening Move:
The Sample MOD copies an existing opening move and modifies it.  In the CnC3XML\SkirmishAI\OpeningMoves file the Sample MOD copies the NODOptimalOpeningMoves.xml file and renamed it to SampleNodOpeningMoves.xml.  Then in here we added the new opening move as so:

<SkirmishOpeningMove

    id="NODSampleOpeningMove"

    Side="NOD">

    <Order Build="NODPowerPlant" />

    <Order Build="NODHandOfNOD" />

    <Order Build="NODSecretShrine" />

    <Order Build="NODShadowSquad" />

    <Order Build="NODShadowSquad" />

    <Order Build="NODShadowSquad" />

    <Order Build="NODShadowSquad" />

    <Order Build="NODShadowSquad" />

    <Order Build="NODRefinery" />

    <Order Build="NODRefinery" />       

    <Order Time="90s" />

</SkirmishOpeningMove>

 

Make sure you give it a unique id.  This id is then referenced in the SampleNodPersonality.xml file:

 

<OpeningMove Name="NODSampleOpeningMove" Weight="100%" Difficulty="HARD"/>

 

This opening move is as you can see only setup for HARD difficulty, and will run everytime due to the Weight being 100%.  You can setup multiple opening moves with different weights to give some variety to your AI personality.
Setting Up A New Targeting Heuristic:

The Sample MOD creates a new targetting heuristic to specifically target an enemies War Factory.  To accomplish this the Sample MOD has a new file called SampleAITargetHeuristics.xml, and in this file it has a new AITargetingHeuristic type copied and then modified from CnC3XML\SkirmishAI\Targets\AITargetHeuristics.xml.  Here is the xml from the SampleMOD:

 

<AITargetingHeuristic

   id="SafestToGroundWarFactory"

   HeuristicType="EnemyStructure"

   SortType="ThreatToGround"

   ReturnTargetType="Structure"

   VitalKindOf="FS_WAR_FACTORY"

   ForbiddenKindOf=""

                                                 />

 

This will be referenced in another new file created for the Sample MOD which is SampleNodStates.xml.  This file defines a new AIStrategicStateDefinition.  This was copied and modified from CnC3XML\SkirmishAI\States\AIStates.xml.  Here is the XML for that:

<AIStrategicStateDefinition

id="NODMacsShadowKillWarFactory"

       UnitUpgradeMultiplier="0.0">

       <Heuristic>               

              <PathToTargetHeuristic PathExists="true"/>

       </Heuristic>

<TargetHeuristic TargetHeuristic="SafestToGroundWarFactory" TargetType="Structure"/>

<Tactic Tactic="SimpleAttack" TargetType="Structure">

<TeamTemplate MinUnits="5" MaxUnits="5" IncludeKindOf="CAN_ATTACK" ExcludeKindOf="AIRCRAFT" AlwaysRelease="false" AlwaysRecruit="false">

       <CreateUnits UnitName="NODShadowSquad"/>

       <CreateUnits UnitName="NODShadowSquad"/>

       <CreateUnits UnitName="NODShadowSquad"/>

       <CreateUnits UnitName="NODShadowSquad"/>

       <CreateUnits UnitName="NODShadowSquad"/>

       </TeamTemplate>

       </Tactic>

</AIStrategicStateDefinition>

 

The new target heuristic is used in the TargetHeuristc tag here.  This state will essentially execute if the enemy has a War Factory and the AI has a team of 5 Nod Shadow Squads.  This state is then referenced in the main personality as so:

 

<States State="NODMacsShadowKillWarFactory" Difficulty="HARD" />

 

You can have many different states defined from which the AI will choose one dependent on conditions in the game.  In this case the new opening moves defined by the Sample AI ensures that the AI will have enough Shadow Squads to execute this state as soon as either the enemy builds a War Factory or as soon as the AI has enough Shadow Squads built.
For additonal AI documentation the MOD SDK has included to very well commented XML files for your perusal.  These can be found in the Documenatation\AI folder of the MOD SDK directory.  The files are: ExampleAI.xml, and ExampleAIStates.xml.
